struct.name: AdditionalInformation
struct.description: A data structures that contains two items of information, an identifier and a problem description.

structMember.name: value
structMember.description: The value or description associated with the identifier.

enum.name: SeverityLevel
enum.description: The possible alarm serverities. The values are aligned to the ERICSSON-ALARM-MIB which is compliant with the IETF understanding of the ITU X.733. SnmpItuAlarmPercSeverity: DESCRIPTION "The perceived severity of the alarm as specified in [X.733] and [X.736]. SYNTAX INTEGER {cleared (1), critical (3), major (4), minor (5), warning (6)} Note: ERICSSON-ALARM-MIB does not support severity indeterminate (2)

enum.name: EventType
enum.description: The general category for the Alarm Type. The allowed values are defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: OTHER
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: COMMUNICATIONSALARM
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: QUALITYOFSERVICEALARM
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: PROCESSINGERRORALARM
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: EQUIPMENTALARM
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: ENVIRONMENTALALARM
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: INTEGRITYVIOLATION
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: OPERATIONALVIOLATION
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: PHYSICALVIOLATION
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: SECURITYSERVICEORMECHANISMVIOLATION
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

enumMember.name: TIMEDOMAINVIOLATION
enumMember.description: Defined by ITU-T X.733 and X.736.

derivedDataType.name: ProbableCause
derivedDataType.description: Probable cause as specified in ITU and ETSI recommendations. The ITU recommendations are M.3100, X.733 and X.736 and the ETSI recommendation is GSM 12.11.

class.name: Fm
class.description: The root MOC of the Fault Management branch.

attribute.name: fmId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: lastSequenceNo
attribute.description: The last used sequence number for an alarm state change notification. The sequence numbers are consecutive. With this attribute, an external system can determine if a resynchronization operation is needed, such as following a loss and restore of a communications link.

attribute.name: sumCritical
attribute.description: Shows the number of active alarms with perceived severity 'critical'.

attribute.name: sumMajor
attribute.description: Shows the number of active alarms with perceived severity ‘major’.

attribute.name: sumMinor
attribute.description: Shows the number of active alarms with perceived severity ‘minor’.

attribute.name: sumWarning
attribute.description: Shows the number of active alarms with perceived severity ‘warning’.

attribute.name: totalActive
attribute.description: Shows the total number of currently active alarms. This corresponds to the the total number of instantiated FmAlarm objects.

attribute.name: lastChanged
attribute.description: The timestamp of when any alarm was last changed. With this attribute, an external system can determine if a resynchronization operation is needed, such as following a loss and restore of a communications link.

attribute.name: heartbeatInterval
attribute.description: The interval in seconds, with which a heartbeat notification is sent to all alarm consumers.

class.name: FmAlarmModel
class.description: This is a container for grouping FM alarm types.

attribute.name: fmAlarmModelId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: FmAlarmType
class.description: A specific kind of alarm that can be reported, for example "power failure". In an X.733 context it maps to event type, probable cause, and specific problem. The same principle is used for alert types as for alarm types.

attribute.name: fmAlarmTypeId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: majorType
attribute.description: The attributes majorType and minorType are the two key attributes used to identify the alarm type.

attribute.name: minorType
attribute.description: The attributes majorType and minorType are the two key attributes used to identify the alarm type.

attribute.name: moClasses
attribute.description: A list of the Managed Object classes that can raise this alarm type. This attribute contains a comma seperated list of Managed Object classes types that use this alarm type. It is for information only.
attribute.statusInformation: This attribute has no purpose and is not used by anyone.

attribute.name: specificProblem
attribute.description: Provides further refinement to the information given by probableCause.

attribute.name: eventType
attribute.description: The general category for the alarm. The allowed values are defined by ITU-T X.733.

attribute.name: probableCause
attribute.description: Qualifies and provides further information on the reason for the event. A standard set of probableCause values is provided in the ERICSSON-ALARM-PC-MIB.

attribute.name: isStateful
attribute.description: Indicates whether the alarm type represents an alarm (has a state) or an alert (has no state). true indicates an alarm and false indicates an alert.

attribute.name: additionalText
attribute.description: Extra information that would not be contained by other FmAlarmType attributes.

attribute.name: configuredSeverity
attribute.description: Gives the possibility to configure the severity for a certain alarm type. If set, this value overrides the severity provided by the alarming object. Setting this attribute has no impact on existing alarms, only new and updated ones.

attribute.name: defaultSeverity
attribute.description: The default severity of the alarm type. The value indicates the severity for all alarms of this type. No value indicates that there is no fixed severity and that the severity is decided by the alarming object depending on the fault.

class.name: FmAlarm
class.description: An FmAlarm instance represents an active alarm. An alarm is a persistent indication of a fault that clears only when the triggering condition has been resolved.

attribute.name: fmAlarmId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: source
attribute.description: The distinguished name of the alarming object.

attribute.name: lastEventTime
attribute.description: The timestamp of when the alarm was last updated. This is set at alarm information change or severity change.

attribute.name: sequenceNumber
attribute.description: A unique identity for every notification sent. This identity changes at every notification, that is, severity change and information change. It is not the same as the fmAlarmId as multiple notifications may be sent for one alarm instance.

attribute.name: activeSeverity
attribute.description: The perceived severity of the alarm.

attribute.name: additionalText
attribute.description: Extra information about the alarm.

attribute.name: majorType
attribute.description: The attributes majorType and minorType are the two key attributes used to identify the alarm type.

attribute.name: minorType
attribute.description: The attributes majorType and minorType are the two key attributes used to identify the alarm type.

attribute.name: specificProblem
attribute.description: Provides further refinement to the information given by probableCause.

attribute.name: eventType
attribute.description: The general category for the alarm. The allowed values are defined by ITU-T X.733.

attribute.name: probableCause
attribute.description: Qualifies and provides further information on the reason for the event. A standard set of probableCause values is provided in the ERICSSON-ALARM-PC-MIB.

attribute.name: additionalInfo
attribute.description: Further information about the problem. The information is represented as a set of data structures with two items of information, an identifier and a problem description. This is typically used to provide information referred to by the OPI.

attribute.name: originalEventTime
attribute.description: The timestamp when the alarm was raised. This attribute is set when the alarm is raised and will not change during the alarm's lifetime.

attribute.name: originalSeverity
attribute.description: The perceived severity level set when the alarm was raised. This attribute is set when the alarm is raised and will not change during the alarm's lifetime.

attribute.name: originalAdditionalText
attribute.description: The additional text set when the alarm was raised. This attribute is set when the alarm is raised and will not change during the alarm's lifetime.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.
